iseplib.classes

Class FileManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • iseplib.classes.FileManager

  • public class FileManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages files and directories. Is divided in three parts: Create/Manage/Erase.
    Version:
    1.0.0 Jan 17, 2020.
    Author:
    Barbatos Rex.

      • mkDir

        public static void mkDir(java.lang.String relativePath)
        Creates a directory in a expecified path.
        Parameters:
        relativePath - The relative or absolute path of the directory to create.

      • fileCreator

        public static void fileCreator(java.lang.String relativePath,
                               java.lang.String name,
                               java.lang.String extension)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a blank file. This method creates a blank file in an already existing directory.
        Parameters:
        relativePath - The relative or absolute path of the file to create.
        name - The name of the file you want to create.
        extension - The extension of the file (".txt",".csv",etc.).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Will throw this exception if permissions for creating a file are not correct.

      • countTheNumberOfLines

        public static int countTheNumberOfLines(java.lang.String relativePath)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Counts the number of lines in a text file.
        Parameters:
        relativePath - The relative or absolute path of an already existing text file.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of lines that a text file has.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Will throw this exception if the file doesn't exist or permissions are not correct.

      • fileExist

        public static boolean fileExist(java.lang.String relativePath)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Verifies the existence of a file.
        Parameters:
        relativePath - The relative or absolute path of an already existing text file.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the file exist otherwise returns false.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Will throw this exception if the file doesn't exist or permissions are not correct.

                              java.lang.String content)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a message to a text file.
        Parameters:
        relativePath - The relative or absolute path of an already existing text file.
        content - The message you want to write to a file.

      • copyFile

        public static void copyFile(java.lang.String relativePathOldFile,
                            java.lang.String newDir,
                            java.lang.String newName,
                            java.lang.String newExtension)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a copy of a file.
        Parameters:
        relativePathOldFile - The relative or absolute path of an already existing text file.
        newDir - The relative or absolute path of the new directory.
        newName - The new name for the copied file
        newExtension - The new extension (".txt",".csv",etc)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Will throw this exception if the file doesn't exist or permissions are not correct.

      • lineEraser

        public static void lineEraser(java.lang.String relativePath,
                              int line)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Erasers a line of a text file.
        Parameters:
        relativePath - The relative or absolute path of an already existing text file.
        line - The number of the line you want to erase.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Will throw this exception if the file doesn't exist or permissions are not correct.
